subject: Cool New Maisie Video
event:
... on the HBO site and YouTube.

The latest installment in the "Artisans" series.  

<iframe title="YouTube video player" class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="640" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/A4BWRMfSPHM" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowFullScreen"></iframe>

Maisie is amazing.  As are Sophie and Isaac, who play Sansa and Bran.  The kids haven't been featured in any of the teasers or trailers to date, but I think you're going to love them once the show hits the air.

comments.article: She is so awesome, and she's exactly what I imagined Arya to be.
I will say honestly, I haven't read the books YET, but to know that you are so excited about the show coming out makes me and I'm sure other fans THAT much MORE excited!!!
Maisie is doing a great job! Small gripe, but is it me or has needle gotten shorter and even more.. needle like as the hilt's gone; can't exactly slash with a blade like that.
comments.subject: Needle needafied?

comments.article: The TV show has gone with something pretty explicitly in the style of a small sword, which is certainly not what was described in the novel. Valyrian Steel's version, with GRRM's direct input, looked more like this in Maisie's hands. (That said, while some small swords relied purely on the point, I think most non-ceremonial examples have edges, so they could give a nasty cut.)
comments.subject: Re: Needle needafied?

comments.article: I hope so. The Stark children and their journey (or rather journies) is definitely one of my favourite parts of the books.

Awesome. Can't wait to see Arya and all the others on the small screen soome!
Thanks for posting this.

Stick 'em with the pointy end!  Thanks...that was a refreshing taste...makes me wonder what kind of music they are dancing to.  Really looking forward to being completely immersed into the world of Ice & Fire on the small screen

I was a bit worried that maybe she was too pretty a little girl to be the rather plain Arya, but seeing her enthusiasm and seriousness about the role has made me feel more comfortable.  She looks to be a great choice.
Congratulations George.  Everything seems to be coming together!
comments.subject: Congratulations

comments.article: Love this.  Can't wait!

Maisie is perfect for the role. What amazing work ethic for such a young actor! Its weird; they did away with details like Dany's eye colour but then made the poor girl learn with her left hand just for posterity! A detail I didn't even know was IN the books! (and I've read them all...allot!)
comments.subject: Video

comments.article: Learning the fights left-handed was at Maisie's insistence, from what they've said.
comments.subject: Re: Video

comments.article: Wow, I'm really happy with Maisie as Arya!  I didn't know what she was like before this, but she seems very smart and like she can definitely take on this role.  So very excited!
She is awesome, and I like so much that she wanted to learn her sword fights left-handed like Arya, although she's right-handed.

comments.upictitle: Impervious horrors of a leeward shore: smile
comments.article: Cool indeedy. Thanks for sharing.
I wish they would promote her more.  She is such a well spoken interviewee, and seems like she will be absolutely brilliant!
She *is* Arya. She and Dinklage were the best casts in the history of...uh, casting. She looks like she's doing an incredible job. I can't wait.
comments.subject: Fantastic

comments.article: As excited as I was about Jason Momoa, Sean Bean, and Peter Dinklage, it's looking more and more like Maisie Williams might be the breakout star of the cast. The kid's adorable.
She's going to be amazing.

Not sure if I can wait the 3 months (or longer since I don't have HBO).  Any chance of this show streaming on Netflix after it's aired?  Spartacus has done that which has been awesome since I don't have the Starz network either.
comments.subject: Game of Thrones

comments.article:
Not any time soon. HBO has been very uninterested in Netflix, feeling that it undermines their core subscription business while giving Netflix a boost.

I believe they have in the past released shows on iTunes, but only after the season is completed.

That said, Netflix has vowed to make another attempt to convince HBO to let them stream their content. Good luck to them.
comments.subject: Re: Game of Thrones

comments.article: Just so.
comments.subject: Delightful

comments.article:
I train in Lameco Eskrima... which is a Filipino martial art that involves stick and blade fighting. As of late though, I've been requesting more and more sword work.. and getting strange looks from my instructor when I refer to it was "Water Dancer" class. Hehehehe.

Needless to say, I loooove this video. I can't get over how perfect Maisie is for Arya!! :)
comments.subject: *LOVE*

comments.article: "as"... not "was". *sleepy*
comments.subject: Re: *LOVE*

comments.upictitle: Avox in Arcadia: Everything Is Changing
comments.article:
Is that girl even real?! Did someone cast a dark spell to summon the perfect child actress from the depths of our collective imagination? 'Cause, if so, it was worth it and they can be forgiven.

So crazy about this kid already. Can't wait to see her playing or posing with Nymeria.
she is adorable! what a cute, scrappy little thing. i feel sorry for what you're going to put her through :P
So excited! I can't wait for the show to come out. <3 The cast is going to be wonderful, and the script doubly so!
Wouldn´t it be great to know what Arya´s doing right now.....
comments.subject: Now
